div.p: On FOIA.gov, you can compare the number of FOIA requests handled by agencies each year.
The data available to you includes the number of FOIA requests
"received," "processed," and "pending" at the beginning or end of the fiscal year.
The number of requests "received" during a given year is very simple:
it includes every request that was sent in to the agency that year.
The number of requests "processed" is a little different:
it includes the requests the agency has finished processing.
In other words, if an agency receives a request during the year
but does not finish all of its work on it during that same year,
the request will count as "received" but not as "processed"
because the agency has not yet taken final action.
Any request which an agency is still working on is considered "pending."
